messages.title: A record of failure
messages.content: After 17 years under Labour, Wales is falling behind – just look at what has happened to our NHS. Their incompetence and their complacency risks Wales' long-term future.

messages.title: Costly experiments
messages.content: Now, under Jeremy Corbyn, Labour wants to continue their costly experiments.

messages.title: Hope for change at the Assembly elections
messages.content: Only by voting Welsh Conservative can you secure competent and caring for governance Wales needs so that we don't get left behind.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Protect the NHS, generating more investment year by year.
Create more Jobs by backing small businesses and improving infrastructure.
Deliver excellence in Education, transforming lives, teaching methods and ensuring more funds to the classroom.
Provide security and dignity for older people, setting a cap on care costs protecting £100,000 of savings for those residing outside a care home.
Ensure sustainable housing by building affordable and accessible support for families.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour only needs to lose one seat to lose control of the Assembly, so every seat and vote will be decisive. Labour have shown weakness by losing Assembly seats from Labour across Wales.

issues.economy: Back small businesses and improve infrastructure.
issues.education: Transform teaching methods and ensure more funds to the classroom.
issues.governance: Competence and caring governance; stop Labour's incompetence and complacency.
issues.health: Protect the NHS; More investment year by year.
issues.socialWelfare: Provide security and dignity for older people, protecting £100,000 of savings for those residing outside a care home.

housing.content: Building affordable and accessible support for families.
